channel.title: Alas for the Awful Sea: Kingsport 1851, Part III
channel.description:
![Kingsport1851p3|500x500](upload://1drl0IGyZvM43GhMiFRWm5FTFms.png)
4 *Thursdays* in May: Kingsport 1851 Part III [date=2019-05-09 time=19:30:00 timezone="America/New_York"] → [date=2019-05-09 time=22:30:00 timezone="America/New_York"] https://bit.ly/2C4ylrp [date=2019-05-16 time=19:30:00 timezone="America/New_York"] → [date=2019-05-16 time=22:30:00 timezone="America/New_York"] https://bit.ly/2ETJgGi [date=2019-05-23 time=19:30:00 timezone="America/New_York"] → [date=2019-05-23 time=22:30:00 timezone="America/New_York"] https://bit.ly/2XICquN [date=2019-05-30 time=19:30:00 timezone="America/New_York"] → [date=2019-05-30 time=22:30:00 timezone="America/New_York"] https://bit.ly/2HiNqcx
The Pacific Ocean, 1851: The bark Tethys finally arrives in the Offshore Fishing Grounds deep in the trackless waters of the Pacific, confronting a final unknown as their destinies come crashing down...
Kingsport 1851: All That Maddens And Torments is the third part of a planned three-month run of Alas for the Awful Sea set aboard an American whaler sailing out of a haunted town in Lovecraft country. It shares continuity with other games in the Kingsport series, and is inspired by Melville's "Moby-Dick". I'll be running four sessions on Thursdays in May, and holding one spot for my long-time collaborator, Seraphina.
Please note this series begins on 9 May, the second Thursday in the month. This series will deal with the subject of whaling; we'll discuss how we wish to treat that as well as subjects including poverty, class distinction, racism, the nature of monstrousness, the silence of God, and the existential malice that animates the world. The total amount of Mythos content will be decided upon as a group. I'll provide the historical and literary context as necessary.
Being able to attend each session is ideal, but not required. You must RSVP to each session you wish to attend.
This sessions will be around 3 hours long, and I'll be recording them for inclusion in the Gauntlet video roundup. We will be using the X-card, lines and veils, and the open door policy. For more information on the Gauntlet's safety tools, please refer to our Inclusivity Policy on the website (http://www.gauntlet-rpg.com/the-inclusivity-policy.html).
